title: Low Priority Queue
body:
I have been put in the low priority queue for 'abandoning' a match, which is not the case. had some early morning internet stability issues and by the time i had reconnected, i had been put in the low priority queue.

seems like a strike rule and you are out is a bit harsh, as i always finish my matches, provided my internet connection doesn't fail on me like it did today.

might need a minor rethink, or base these demotions on a pattern of leaving matches, rather than being al draconian about it.

replies.body:
>by the time i had reconnected

you dc'd, you abandoned a match. also you make it sound like your internet fails you a lot.

The old Leaver Buster system worked on a % rate where it calculated the games you DC in against the games you don't. It ended up never punishing anyone.

The New Leaver Buster is take no prisoners and punish everyone without mercy for leaving or AFKing. And it GETS THE JOB DONE, unlike what Lord Sesshy keeps complaining about.

i agree with you, people who have unstable internet connections and dc for 5 minutes every 2nd or 3rd game cant play lol anymore, its that simple leaver buster just tramples them into the dust, no one wants to wait 40 min to play a 30 min game where they will probably lag anyway,
so i think leaver buster should only be for ranked, that way people who have unstable connections don't affect the rankings of other players, but can still play the game with others in normals, and people always say "just play custom games" but thats the same as not playing at all, custom games get old very fast, its no fun playing a team game by yourself.

I've already told you on many an occasion that your opinion on this matter is BAD, and just doesn't work in a practice situations.

If no one is ever punished for anything in Normals, then within a month, even less than a month, Normals would become dead. It would be filled with trolls and trolls ONLY. Basically you would only ever play normals from that point on if you wanted to be abused until you cried like a little %%%%%.
